animation
Class AnimationStateQueue

java.lang.Object
  animation.AnimationStateQueue

 class AnimationStateQueue
extends java.lang.Object

A complex data structure for helping the animator to queue animation states, so that the states can be allocated to the turns they were created in.

Constructor Summary
AnimationStateQueue()
          Initiates a new animation state queue.
 
Method Summary
(package private)  void add(AnimationState animationState)
          Adds an animation state to the current open queue.
(package private)  boolean isEmpty()
          Returns true if queue is empty, else false.
(package private)  boolean isEndOfCurrentQueue()
          Returns true if current inner queue is empty, else false.
(package private)  boolean isEndOfTurn()
          Returns true if current inner queue contains the minimum amount of states needed to display a turn: This is true if all states that indicate a state transformation within a turn, have been removed.
(package private)  boolean isStartOfCurrentQueue()
          Returns true if current inner queue has just started, else false.
(package private)  AnimationState remove()
          Removes the next state from the queue and returns it.

clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

Method Detail

add

void add(AnimationState animationState)
Adds an animation state to the current open queue. Also opens a new queue if a new turn starts.

Parameters:
animationState -

isEmpty

boolean isEmpty()
Returns true if queue is empty, else false.

Returns:
true if queue is empty, else false.

remove

AnimationState remove()
Removes the next state from the queue and returns it. Returns null if wueue is empty.

Returns:
the next state from the queue.

isStartOfCurrentQueue

boolean isStartOfCurrentQueue()
Returns true if current inner queue has just started, else false.

Returns:
true if current inner queue has just started, else false.

isEndOfTurn

boolean isEndOfTurn()
Returns true if current inner queue contains the minimum amount of states needed to display a turn: This is true if all states that indicate a state transformation within a turn, have been removed.

Returns:
true if current inner queue only contains minimum number of states to display a full turn.

isEndOfCurrentQueue

boolean isEndOfCurrentQueue()
Returns true if current inner queue is empty, else false.

Returns:
true if current inner queue is empty, else false.
